name: Composting
description: Natural decomposition of organic matter to create nutrient-rich soil amendment. Composting improves soil structure, water retention, and provides essential nutrients.
benefits: Improves soil fertility, reduces waste, enhances water retention, promotes beneficial microorganisms, reduces need for chemical fertilizers
applicationMethod: Mix materials in layers, maintain moisture, turn regularly, apply mature compost to soil

name: Vermicomposting
description: Composting using earthworms to break down organic waste into high-quality fertilizer. Produces nutrient-rich vermicast and liquid fertilizer.
benefits: Fast decomposition, produces liquid fertilizer, high nutrient content, odorless process, excellent for seedlings
applicationMethod: Set up worm bins, add organic waste regularly, harvest vermicast every 2-3 months, dilute liquid for foliar spray

name: Neem-Based Pest Control
description: Natural insecticide derived from neem tree seeds. Effective against various pests while safe for beneficial insects when used properly.
benefits: Broad spectrum pest control, biodegradable, non-toxic to humans and animals, also acts as fungicide
applicationMethod: Crush neem seeds, soak in water overnight, strain and spray on plants. For oil: mix with soap and water, spray early morning or evening
duration: Effect lasts 5-7 days, reapply as needed

name: Fermented Plant Juice (FPJ)
description: Korean Natural Farming technique using fermented plant materials to create liquid fertilizer rich in nutrients and beneficial microorganisms.
materials: Young plant shoots (banana, papaya, or malunggay)
benefits: Rich in growth hormones, enhances plant vigor, improves disease resistance, promotes flowering and fruiting
applicationMethod: Chop plants, mix with equal weight of brown sugar, ferment for 7 days, dilute 1:500 with water for application

name: Crop Rotation
description: Systematic planting of different crops in sequence on the same land to improve soil health and reduce pest and disease buildup.
benefits: Breaks pest cycles, improves soil fertility naturally, reduces disease pressure, enhances biodiversity
applicationMethod: Alternate between nitrogen-fixing and nitrogen-consuming crops. Follow heavy feeders with light feeders. Include cover crops
duration: Seasonal rotation (3-4 crop cycles per year)

name: Fish Amino Acid (FAA)
description: Fermented fish solution providing amino acids, minerals, and enzymes for plant growth. Excellent nitrogen source.
benefits: High nitrogen content, rich in amino acids, improves plant immunity, enhances fruit quality, promotes vegetative growth
applicationMethod: Layer fish with sugar in jar, ferment for 3 months, extract liquid, dilute 1:1000 for foliar spray or soil drench

name: Indigenous Microorganisms (IMO)
description: Collection and cultivation of beneficial local microorganisms to improve soil health and plant growth.
benefits: Improves soil structure, enhances nutrient availability, suppresses diseases, increases beneficial microbes, speeds decomposition
applicationMethod: Collect wild microbes on rice, multiply with molasses and bran, apply to compost or directly to soil

name: Botanical Pesticides
description: Plant-based pest control solutions using locally available plants with insecticidal properties.
benefits: Safe for environment, low cost, readily available, targets specific pests, no residue issues
applicationMethod: Chop and soak materials in water (24 hours), strain, add soap, spray on affected plants every 3-5 days
duration: Effective for 3-4 days, reapply after rain

name: Green Manuring
description: Growing and incorporating specific crops into soil to improve fertility and organic matter content.
benefits: Adds nitrogen to soil, improves soil structure, suppresses weeds, prevents erosion, provides organic matter
applicationMethod: Plant green manure crop, allow to grow 6-8 weeks, cut and incorporate into soil 2 weeks before main crop
duration: 6-8 weeks for green manure crop growth

name: Mulching
description: Covering soil with organic materials to conserve moisture, suppress weeds, and improve soil health.
benefits: Conserves soil moisture, regulates temperature, suppresses weeds, prevents erosion, adds organic matter as it decomposes
applicationMethod: Spread 2-4 inches of organic material around plants, keep away from stems, replenish as needed
